definition: bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a three-dimensional tea bag.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種立體袋泡茶袋。

sentences.english: Americans usually use tea bags to make their tea.
sentences.chinese: 美國人通常用茶袋來泡茶。

sentences.english: Well, the Penguin Tea Timer happily does the waiting for you.
sentences.chinese: 現在企鵝泡茶定時器可以幫你代勞啦。

sentences.english: To steep in or as if in the manner of tea.
sentences.chinese: 用泡茶的方式進會浸泡。

sentences.english: You can make tea with jujubes, too.
The workers were brewing up in a sheltered corner of the building-site.
sentences.chinese: 工人們在建築工地的避風處泡茶喝。

sentences.english: Natural mountain spring water is best for tea.
sentences.chinese: 泡茶用的水，以天然的山泉水爲上。

sentences.english: Teabag in export volume has remained in first place in Guangxi.
sentences.chinese: 袋泡茶年出口量一直保持在廣西第一的位置。

sentences.english: Now the cup is ready for the water, so we will wait for the water to boil.
sentences.chinese: 在燒水的同時我們可以準備袋泡茶。

sentences.english: A good woman is like a tea bag when you put her in hot water she only gets stronger.
sentences.chinese: 好女人就像是袋泡茶，把她放進熱水裏她的味道更濃。

sentences.english: The water boiling between the crab-eye stage and the fish-eye stage is the best for preparing tea.
sentences.chinese: 泡茶用的開水，一般以蟹眼已過魚眼生時最好。

sentences.english: She just did needlework and made tea.
sentences.chinese: 她只是做針線活和泡茶。

sentences.english: The third set is that of halfnaked strippers .
sentences.chinese: 第三套袋泡茶是半裸的脫衣舞女。

sentences.english: Dry mouth can often Ophiopogon japonicus, such as Chinese medicine Shashen tea drinking.
sentences.chinese: 口腔乾燥可經常用麥冬，沙蔘等中藥泡茶飲用。

sentences.english: Thirdly, the pot should be warmed beforehand.
Susan got a pink wrapper and got a pink china cup for his tea .
sentences.chinese: 蘇姍取來粉色的晨衣，用粉色的瓷杯給他泡茶。

definition: (fig.) to have a meeting with state security agents (to be warned to behave "responsibly")
to add water (or other liquid) to (another ingredient such as powdered milk or tea leaves)/to infuse (tea)
tea prepared in large quantity using inexpensive tea leaves
very concentrated type of tea drunk in Chaozhou, Fujian and Taiwan
to have tea and refreshments/to have dimsum lunch (Cantonese)
